intro: Thaumatococcus daniellii var. puberulifolius, commonly known as the African star apple, is a tropical plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with hairy, lance-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into round, star-shaped fruits with a sweet, aromatic pulp. Its fruit is often consumed fresh or used in traditional medicine due to its nutritional and medicinal properties.
